instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2251: What is A2251? A2251 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3348, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01949..
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.A2159: What is A2159? A2159 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3301, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01598..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Trackpad Cpmatibility
threads.message: Hey all, have a question about a trackpad for the new <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Macbook Pro - ordered one off Aliexpress but it wasn't the right size, it was slightly too large for the frame. I contacted the supplier and they said that the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> all use the same trackpad and I can see online several listings that say this as well, but obviously my eyes are telling me another story. I held this one up to an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> trackpad I have in stock and it is the same size, so to me it seems that the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> are the same and at some point they changed the size. Just to arm myself with a little more knowledge and avoid getting another wrong part, which models of these newer generations have compatible trackpads with each other?
